description.narrative: Otros Mundos will support the organization of the Living Rivers Movement (Movimiento Rios Vivos). The numerous hydroelectric projects throughout Colombia pose a serious threat to the culture of populations dependent on rivers and food security locally and nationally. Part of the problem is that these projects are often promoted as part of a clean and free energy solution and a development plan supporting equality. With the funds, the group will research counter arguments to the dams as clean and free; provide trainings for affected communities; raise awareness about conflicts and the impacts of these development projects; and organize regional discussions with a variety of stakeholders and actors about the infeasibility environmentally and socially of dams.
